body.p: XPath is a query language for selecting nodes from an XML document. To use XPath expressions effectively, you need a good understanding of the XPath Core Function Library.

section.title: The XPath Toolbar

p.ph: provides an XPath toolbar to let you query XML documents fast and easy using XPath expressions.

section.p: You can choose the XPath version from the drop-down menu available in the left side of the toolbar. Available options include XPath 1.0, XPath 2.0, XPath 2.0 SA, XPath 3.0, XPath 3.0 SA.

p.note: XPath 2.0 SA and XPath 3.0 SA use the Saxon EE XML Schema version option.
The results returned by XPath 2.0 SA and XPath 3.0 SA have a location limited to the line number of the start element (there are no column information and no end specified).
uses Saxon to execute XPath 3.0 expressions, but implements a part of the 3.0 functions. When using a function that is not implemented, can return a compilation error.

body.note: During the execution of an XPath expression, the XPath toolbar displays a stop button . Press this button to stop the XPath execution.
body.p: When you type expressions longer than 60 characters, a dialog pops up and offers you the possibility to switch to the XPath builder view.
